title.narrative: KENYA COVID-19 HEALTH EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROJECT

description.narrative: To prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness.

condition.narrative: Finalize and adopt Part B.2(a), Sec. I, Sch. 2 – The Recipient shall no later than thirty days after the Effective Date of the FA,prepare and furnish to the Association a proposed work plan and budget for Project implementation.

Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, A.5(a)The Recipient (the Republic of Kenya) shall within thirty (30) days after theEffective Date establish and thereafter maintain throughout Project implementation, a Project Management Team (“PMT”), withadequate resources and facilitation, key staff holding such qualifications and under terms of reference acceptable to theAssociation, such staff to include a project manager, a monitoring and evaluation specialist, at least one dedicated specialist foreach of social risks and environmental risks management and any other technical and fiduciary specialists as may have been agreedwith the Association and as further detailed in the Project Implementation Manual (“PIM”).

Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, B.1(a) No later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, the Recipient shallprepare a project implementation manual containing detailed arrangements and procedures for implementation of the Project, furnishto and exchange views with the Association on such manual promptly upon its preparation, and consequently adopt such manual asshall have been approved in writing by the Association (Project Implementation Manual or PIM); and thereafter implement the Projectin accordance with the requirements set forth in the PIM.

Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, B.2(a) The Recipient shall no later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date:(i) prepare and furnish to the Association a proposed work plan and budget for Project implementation setting forth (A) a detaileddescription of the planned activities, including any proposed conferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered bythe plan; (B) the sources and proposed use of funds thereof; (C) procurement and environmental and social risks managementarrangements thereof, as applicable and; (D) responsibility for the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start andcompletion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to track progress of each activity; (ii) taking into account the Association'scomments, finalize the plan and furnish it to Association for its approval; and (iii) adopt the plan as shall have been approved bythe Association (Work Plan and Budget or WPB).
Part B.1(a), Sec. I, Sch. 2 – The Recipient shall no later than thirty days after the Effective Date of the FA, prepare a revisedand updated project implementation manual.

Part B.3, Sec. I, Sch. 2 – The Recipient shall from the Effective Date of the FA, and for a period of twelve (12) months thereafteror such longer period as may be indicated in writing by the Association, vest in the Office of the Auditor General theresponsibility of acting as an independent verification agent.

Schedule 1, Section I.B.3 (a): no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit a firm with qualifications,experience, independence and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association (Independent Integrated Fiduciary ReviewAgent or IIFRA), as part of the Recipient's measures to ensure that the that Credit proceeds are used for the purposes intended asmay be further detailed in the PIM

Schedule 2, Section I.A.2: Kenya Medical Supplies Agency (KEMSA). The Recipient shall designate KEMSA to procure and distributemedical supplies and equipment under the Project, provided that - unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Association - medicalsupplies and equipment financed through the proceeds of the Second Additional Financing will be procured by UN agencies on behalfof the Ministry of Health.

Sec II., Sch. 5.3 (c) – cause the IVA, not later than thirty (30) days, after completion of the IVA's review, to prepare andfurnish to the Recipient and the Association, a report on the results of said review and verification process of such scope and insuch detail as the Association shall reasonably request.
